result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Heisler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit of 134 days were granted.
08-20-2014 COURT AMENDS CREDIT TIME TO 130 DAYS

superMiscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for New Berlin Police Department. Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  
Attend the Victim Impact Panel meeting as a condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant David J. Heisler in court, in custody, with Attorney Thomas Grieve.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Brendong Reyes and Assistant District Attonrey Lesli Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count#1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Grieve makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE:   

6 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 134 days)
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Attend Victim Impact Panel

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to New Berlin Police Department);

FINE :  $2,531.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Hearing on May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
